p:
Light possess significant role in growth and development of plants. The application of different light sources as eliciting phytochemicals in pharmaceutical plants is getting deep attention. UV-C irradiation is one of them that play role in switching control expression of genes associated with growth and secondary metabolism of cells
34 . The current study involves the interactive influence of Ultraviolet-C radiation and different light regimes on callus cultures of F. indica. The results indicated optimal biomass accumulation (FW: 438.3 g/L; DW: 16.4 g/L) in cultures exposed to UV-C radiation (5.4 kJ/m 2) for 30 min under photoperiod (16L/8D h) (Fig. 1a). This was followed by cultures grown under continuous light (24 h) with maximum biomass (FW: 345.9 g/L; DW: 13.9 g/L) at respective dose (7.2 kJ/m 2) of UV-C radiation for 40 min and biomass accumulation (FW: 227.2 g/L; DW: 9.43 g/L) in dark after 20 min exposure to UV radiation (3.6 kJ/m 2) as compared with controls respectively [Fig. 1b, c].
